intro: Lychnophora granmogolensis, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a shrub or small tree native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It has small, dark green leaves that are opposite and lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that turns red when mature. It is often found in humid, tropical environments and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
